data.text: Bringing a Sleeping Pad to Hammock Camping is a Good Idea
I just found out the hard way that it is a pretty good idea still bring a sleeping pad even when using a hammock. That breeze from below the hammock can really bring a good chill.
Check out what’s called an under quilt.

data.text: As much as I love my hennessy hammock I can't use it in backcountry/remote areas anymore. I was backpacking a few years ago and still til this day dont know exactly what happened, If i was dreaming or what. I felt something brush underneath my hammock enough to move me and I woke up in a pitch black panic (bug netting& rainfly) and shuffled around and got twisted up in my sleeping bag and then woke up the next morning sleeping the opposite direction. I cant recall much except the feeling of being panicked/trapped. Stuck to my 1p tent since.
